newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Retevision takes three bids, not Unisource.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Retevision takes three bids, not Unisource.

text.p: Retevision said on Tuesday three bids had been accepted for the state's sale of 60 percent of what will be Spain's second telephone service provider.
The AT&T -led Unisource request for participation could not be accepted because it did not conform to the rules of the bid, Retevision said in a statement.

The three groups accepted are: Deutsche Telekom, France Telecom, Sprint Corp and Banco Central Hispano ; Stet International, Endesa, Union Fensoa, Basque group Euskaltel and several Basque banks; and Mannesmann.

In a statement last week, Retevision said Mannesmann had said it was in talks with AT&T on possible participation in the bid, but there was no mention of the U.S.-based telecoms operator in the statement on Tuesday.
The groups must present a final list of their participants by May 12 and their bids by June 9.

Unisource, a consortium of telecoms flagships from the Netherlands, Switzerland and Sweden, had requested a delay in the deadline to present its candidacy. Although that request was denied, it can still participate in the bid by joining another group.
